article_html: ‘Youth is happy,’ Kafka once posited, ‘because it has the capacity to see beauty’. Youth is also happy because it has finally worked out how to dress for a red-carpet event. The new guard – Kendall, Bieber, Cara et al – owned the Met Ball red carpet, via some serious gowns, body-con, metallic ticks and touches – and literal dressing. To wit: the plethora of Alexander Wang, tasteful flash fleshing (compared with Jennifer Lopez, Cyrus kept it PG) and Justin Bieber in his deltoid-enhancing, custom-made Balmain dragon-embellished jacket because, hey, the theme was China: Through the Looking Glass (just in case you missed the memo)
authors: Photograph Matt Baron Bei Rex Shutterstock
text: ‘Youth is happy,’ Kafka once posited, ‘because it has the capacity to see beauty’. Youth is also happy because it has finally worked out how to dress for a red-carpet event. The new guard – Kendall, Bieber, Cara et al – owned the Met Ball red carpet, via some serious gowns, body-con, metallic ticks and touches – and literal dressing. To wit: the plethora of Alexander Wang, tasteful flash fleshing (compared with Jennifer Lopez, Cyrus kept it PG) and Justin Bieber in his deltoid-enhancing, custom-made Balmain dragon-embellished jacket because, hey, the theme was China: Through the Looking Glass (just in case you missed the memo)
title: Met Ball 2015: the young guns' red-carpet triumph - in pictures
